item.title: Single Slit Diffraction
item.description: Continuing from our discussion of Single slit diffraction, (which we will do in the future ðŸ˜… ) we know that to find the actual/complete diffraction pattern we need to consider each point in the slit as a source of light and find the resultant amplitude (actually resultant electric field displacement) at the concerned point on the screen. This involves some interesting maths and logic. But before finding that infinte sum, lets look at a simplified finite case.
